Power continued to flow from Tuscon into the figure beneath him, a
pulsing flow of energy moving from Tuscon's chest, down his arm and
into the figure on the bed. Meanwhile the insectoids continued thier
relentless attacks, on both Vestige and Tuscon!

Suddenly the door slammed open, the sounds of buzzing insects could be
heard, as a swarm of them flew into the room. Blue ones, red ones,
silver ones, black ones, each of all shapes and sizes. However in the
midst of that a female walked, the insects flying around her obeying
her and yet giving her a wide birth at the same time. She was tall,
taller than any of the insects, her movements smooth and flowing. She
was black and red with large insect like wings sitting on her back,
designed something like seeker wings on a transformer. Her limbs were
supple and femine, but there was no mistaking the strength and power
that was held within them.

"Tuscon, Tuscon." She said as she turned her gaze upon him, her eyes
were crimson multifaceted eyes. "You believe that your leader was the
what we wanted?" She tilted her head, "Ahh" she said as just just
understanding it, "It is that singular thinking you have."

She chuckled as she looked over at Vesige, the insects were swarming
over him, causing him to falter under thier onslaught. "You have
gotten this far only because I we have allowed it."

At a gesture from the larger female the swarm of insects that were
attacking Tuscon and Vestige leaped into the air and began to hover
aroud the cieling of the room as the room itself began to warp and
spin as if the very world around him was changing, altering, or
perhaps returning to normal.

The last whisper of a voice, "Perhaps you gave us exactly what we
wanted . . . " then there is laughter.

The world goes black . . . and then Tuscon is aware of the medbay as
his systems come back online. He can hear the voice of Santon, "It is
done. Rodimus is comming out of it and Tuscon's systems are comming
back to normal levels. We have done it, they are safe."

A quiet laughter plays in Tuscon's head, or perhaps just a memeory of
it, but it falls silent as the real world beckons for Tuscon's
attention.

(TAG)

Preston
